stories.title: Why Working from Home Will Stick

stories.text:
I realized today that my upvotes on comments have either delayed or no effect, while my upvotes on submissions seem immediate, but with the odd inability to unvote without a long delay or no effect. To test this, I did the following:

1. COMMENTS: Upvoted several recent comments of different users through different threads. Refreshed their user profile in separate tab (multiple times) and observed no increase/decrease in karma. Same results when going back and forth refreshing same tab. Removing cache nor using a separate browser (not logged in) had any effect.

2. SUBMISSIONS: Using the same method as above, I upvoted several submissions in new (but older) status. Strangely, the submission would rise by one point, but after unvoting, would remain unaffected, but possibly retract with a significant delay.

I can certainly imagine a purpose or reason for delays, but I'd never noticed previously. My effect (or ineffect) on comments does seem new.

Is this behavior induced moderation voodoo, or standard?
stories.title: Ask HN: Upvotes have seemingly new, limited effect or delay

stories.text:
Am I the only one experiencing this with Google?

The primary number I had associated with my cell phone had a 10 dollar balance on it, and I literally put the google voice number on presentations.

Despite logging in frequently to check it online, they sent me repeated warning emails and eventually took back the number, despite having a 10 USD balance on the account.

Now they are coming after my personal google voice number.

Google needs to be regulated as a utility if they are going to provide phone numbers. This is a huge problem.
stories.title: Google keeps stealing my Google voice numbers, despite having a credit balance
